item.description:
Cinema City is doing a series of classic movies on Sundays at 11:00am. ALL TICKETS ARE ONLY $5 ($4 if you are a Criterion Club member.) I am going to schedule meetups for all of them even if I cannot attend, to let people know about them.

This is the 1947 version, with Maureen O'Hara, John Payne, Edmund Gwenn, Gene Lockhart, and Natalie Wood. When a woman who has raised her daughter to not believe in fairy tales such as the Easter Bunny and Santa Claus hires a homeless man to play Santa, she gets more than she bargains for. After the man is institutionalized as insane because he claims to really be Santa Claus, the young lawyer whom the woman has been dating decides to defend him by arguing in court that he is the real thing. And he receives help from a very surprising source.

group.name: Beyond the Multiplex: Hartford's Indie and Foreign Film fans

item.name: "Miracle on 34th Street" - Cine Classics at Cinema City at the Palace
